page.title: 07Northaw School,W.Tytherley.
page.content: There is a village called Northaw near Hertfordshire,where there was a school named after the village.In 1929 the school moved to Kent,but in 1952 it was burnt down.Then the school moved to West Tytherley in 1953.Before the building was used as a school it was a private house called{Norman {Court.}There are 129 boys and 53 girls in the school,67 of the children are day pupils and 115 of the children are borders.The age range is from 3 to 14.In the Summer their sports are cricket,swimming,rounders and tennis.In the Winter their sports are football,netball,hockey,rugby and others.The school uniform colours are blue,fawn and grey and the school badge is a black horse.There are 16 classrooms,there are 37 teachers and staff and 48 acres of land. { }
